Title: Economic reform… Accelerating growth with price stability
Summary: In commemoration of the 2025 Democracy Day, President Bola Ahmed Tinubu drew the attention of the National Assembly to the benefits of the reforms embarked on by his administration .

Title: Errant jurists: Enforcing rule of law or political witch-hunt?
Summary: Disciplining of judicial officers in the country is explicitly governed by the provisions of the 1999 Constitution and the Judicial Discipline Regulations . However, the National Judicial Council (NJC) stands as the sole disciplinary body for judges .

Title: Labour says N70,000 minimum wage is a fair deal
Summary: Organised labour said despite biting inflation and weak purchasing power, the N70,000 new wage floor is an achievement it is proud of . With over 130 per cent improvement over the last minimum wage of N30,000, the organised labour said .

Title: Two years on, still massaging insecurity
Summary: Joe Ajayi was found dead after he was kidnapped from his home in Odo-Ape, Kabba-Bunu, Kogi State . The story is a graphic representation of how well terrorism has become localised .

Title: Flash floods: Lagos urges residents to stay alert amid heavy rainfall warnings
Summary: Lagos urges residents to stay alert amid heavy rainfall warnings . Heavy rainfall is expected to result in flash floods across the state . Lagos State government has called on residents to remain vigilant .

Title: Police arrest suspected killer of Minnesota lawmaker
Summary: Suspected killer of Democratic state lawmaker and her husband was taken into custody without force on Sunday, after a two-day manhunt . US law enforcement officials in Minnesota said the suspected killer of a Democratic state .

Title: ‘One-way’ driver kills tricyclist, flees scene – LASTMA
Summary: One-way SUV driver fled after colliding with a tricycle operator, resulting in the operator’s tragic death . The Lagos State Traffic Management Authority (LASTMA) says the driver fled the scene .

Title: Israel-Iran conflict: Marketers hike petrol prices as crude oil hits $74pb
Summary: The ongoing Israeli-Iran conflict has triggered upward adjustment in petrol prices by 10 marketers . Crude oil rose 8.8 per cent to $74 per barrel from $68 per barrel .

Title: The implications of Israeli/Iran war
Summary:
THE bombing of Iranian nuclear sites by Israel started as a child's play.

Title: Israel-Iran conflict: Trump warns Iran not to attack
Summary: President Donald Trump has warned Tehran not to strike any U.S. targets just as he lauded Israel's offensive . Trump has also praised Israel's actions in the wake of the conflict .

Title: 14 arrested after protesters set truck, driver ablaze in Benue
Summary: Benue State Police Command said it has arrested 14 suspects who hijacked the peaceful protest by some youths in Makurdi, the state capital, on Sunday . Title: Hajj scam: Kwara begins investigation as gov refunds victims
Summary: Kwara State Governor, AbdulRahman AbdulRazaq, has reimbursed pilgrims from the state who fell victim to a foreign currency scam in Saudi Arabia . This was disclosed by the state Muslim Pilgrims Welfare Board on Sunday . The board, responding to viral videos from Saudi Arabia, said preliminary findings indicated the fraud likely occurred after

Title: Akure families evict landlords, cite S’Court victory
Summary: Olokunjuwon and Umelu families, owners of land in Alagbaka Extension of Akure, the Ondo State capital, insist that landlords and owners of properties in the community allegedly trespassed on their land, despite Supreme Court judgment . Title: Again, Oliseh frowns at foreign coaches
Summary: Sunday Oliseh has strongly opposed the continued appointment of foreign managers to lead the Nigerian national team . He said Nigerians possess the technical capacity and pedigree to handle the Super Eagles, and should be given the opportunity to do so . Title: Bauchi CP mourns as about-to-wed DPO, two friends killed in crash
Summary: The Bauchi State Police Command is mourning the tragic death of a 42-year-old Divisional Police Officer of the Railway Division, Mustapha Garba, who died in a fatal car crash less than an hour before his wedding Fatiha . The accident involved a Mercedes-Benz driven by the DPO, with two
